Assembled from various acquisitions of the Russel B. Nye Popular Culture Collection at the Michigan State University Libraries .
The Wizard of Id (Brant Parker & Johnny Hart), 1/4/?? (Sunday). 1. Newspaper comic strips. I. [Each strip title and date]. II. [Each creator] Call no.: oversize PN6726 .O7

139.title: Flash Gordon
139.author: by Dan Barry.
139.series: Aug. 8, 1960) "Somehow the Plague has Spread to the Other Satellite!"*
notes: Summary: Someone has broken the quarantine.

140.title: Flash Gordon
140.author: Dan Barry.
140.series: Aug. 9, 1960) "Dale, Have You Gotten Your Interferon Shots?"
notes: Summary: A lab assistant probably carried the plague.

141.title: Flash Gordon
141.author: Dan Barry.
141.series: Aug. 10, 1960) "I Want to Take Dale Off the Hook"*
notes: Summary: Steve confesses to Flash that he was the one who jumped quarantine.

142.title: Flash Gordon
142.author: Dan Barry.
notes: Summary: Angry men surround Steve when they hear him say he carried the plague.

143.title: Flash Gordon
143.author: Dan Barry.
143.series: Aug. 12, 1960) "My Wife is on that Satellite, Killer!"*
notes: Summary: The doctor tries to stop the mob beating Steve.

144.title: Flash Gordon
144.author: [No author]
144.series: Dec. 20, 1967) Guy L'Eclair. p. 19 in European Newspaper Comic Strips : a survey of 79 strips collected from various European papers dated August 16 to September 10, 1968
notes: Flash Gordon for Dec. 20, 1967, in French.

145.title: Flash Gordon
145.author: Dan Barry.
145.series: Apr. 28, 1985) "I Will Not Be a Party to Ritual Executions"*
notes: Summary: Julah has escaped, Matara tries to work the rejuvenator herself, and says Zarkov will die in Julah's place.

146.title: Flash Gordon
146.author: by Dan Barry.
146.series: Apr. 29, 1985) "You Sent Me a Phony Distress Message Because You Must Marry?"*
notes: Summary: Princess Thalia says she's still in love with Flash.

147.title: Flash Gordon
147.author: by Dan Barry.
147.series: Apr. 30, 1985) "I Am Promised to a Young Island Prince I Cannot Abide!"*

148.title: Flash Gordon
148.author: by Dan Barry.
148.series: May 1, 1985) "Reject Princess Thalia? My Brothers Would Be Very Displeased"*
notes: Summary: Flash is not allowed to refuse marriage.

149.title: Flash Gordon
149.author: by Dan Barry.
149.series: May 2, 1985) "You Marry Our Sister, or We Defend Her Honor, One By One, to the Death"*

150.title: Flash Gordon
150.author: by Dan Barry.
notes: Summary: Flash delivers another insult to Princess Thalia.

151.title: Flash Gordon
151.author: by Dan Barry.
151.series: May 4, 1985) "Pick Up That Sword and Defend Yourself, Dog of an Outworlder!"*

152.title: Flash Gordon
152.author: [No author]
152.series: 1986) The Deep Freeze : a Coloring Book.
notes: Protagonist is Flash Gordon, with cameos by The Phantom, Lothar, and Mandrake the Magician ; villain is Ming the Merciless.

153.title: Flash Comics
notes:
Anthology comic book (1940-1949), continued after a 10-year hiatus by The Flash. Features include
  • The Atom (issues 80, 82-85, 89-95, 97-100, 102-104)
  • Black Canary (issues 92-104)
  • Cliff Cornwall (issues 1-17)
  • Cotton-Top Katie (issue 88)
  • The Flash (issues 1-104)
  • The Ghost Patrol (issues 29-65, 69-104)
  • Hawkman (issues 1-104)
  • Hop Harrigan (issues 66-68)
  • Johnny Thunder (issues 11-91)
  • Johnny Thunderbolt (issues 1-10)
  • The King (issues 16-37, 39-41)
  • King Standish (issues 3-15)
  • Les Sparks (issues 16-28)
  • Les Watts (issues 12-15)
  • Little Boy Blue (issue 81)
  • Minute Movies (issues 1-59)
  • Mutt and Jeff (issue 70)
  • Picture Stories from the Bible (issue 38)
  • Picture Stories from American History (issues 60, 62-64, 67-68)
  • Rockhead McWizzard (issues 72, 77-79)
  • Rod Rian of the Sky Police (issues 2-11)
  • Simp Odill (issue 66)
  • The Whip (issues 1-55)
This list of features originates from the one in Howard Keltner's Index to Golden Age Comic Books (Detroit, Mich. : J. Bails, 1976).
